text: Sir Vaughan Frederick Randal Jones (31 December 1952 â€“ 6 September 2020) was a New Zealand mathematician. He was known for his work on von Neumann algebras and knot polynomials. He was awarded a Fields Medal in 1990. He was born in Gisborne, New Zealand. Jones died on 6 September 2020 from problems caused by an ear infection at the age of 67. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2020 deaths Category:New Zealand scientists Category:Mathematicians Category:Fields Medalists
title: Vaughan Jones
